qas.question: How many paying customers did Comcast have in 1994?
Comcast's customer base in 1994 was good enough for what national ranking among its competition?
What sports network was Comcast a founding investor of?
In what year did Comcast take over a majority interest in QVC?
What company did Comcast sell its interest in QVC to in 2004?
How many additional subscribers did Comcast receive by merging with Maclean-Hunter?
How much was the Comcast UK branch purchased for?
What percentage of CBS did Comcast own?
When did Comcast buy Liberty Media?
How much did Comcast sell the Golf Channel for in 2004?

context: In 1994, Comcast became the <a1_0>third largest<a1_0/> cable operator in the United States with around <a0_0><b5_0>3.5 million<b5_0/><a0_0/> subscribers following its purchase of Maclean-Hunter's American division for <b6_0>$1.27 billion<b6_0/>. The company's UK branch, Comcast UK Cable Partners, goes public while constructing a cable telecommunications network. With five other media companies, the corporation becomes an original investor in <a2_0>The Golf Channel<a2_0/>. Following a bid in <a3_0>1994<a3_0/> for $2.1 billion, Comcast increased its ownership of QVC from <b7_0>15.5%<b7_0/> of stock to a majority, in a move to prevent QVC from merging with CBS. Comcast later sold its QVC shares in <b8_0>2004<b8_0/> to <a4_0>Liberty Media<a4_0/> for <b9_0>$7.9 billion<b9_0/>.
